meanings.definition: To graze (verb) land excessively, causing damage to the vegetation.
meanings.sent1: The cows overgraze the field, eating too much grass.
meanings.sent2: Farmers must be careful not to overgraze their pastures to keep the land healthy.
meanings.sent3: The sheep decided to overgraze the meadow, thinking they were helping with lawn maintenance.
meanings.sent4: The relentless goats overgraze the hillside, leaving it barren and lifeless.
meanings.sent5: If you overgraze your lawn, it will become brown and patchy.

meanings.definition: The act of overgrazing (noun) can lead to soil erosion and desertification.
meanings.sent1: Overgraze can harm the environment by destroying plant life.
meanings.sent2: The overgraze of the grasslands caused irreversible damage to the ecosystem.
meanings.sent3: The overgraze of the park by the rabbits turned it into a barren wasteland.
meanings.sent4: The overgraze of the meadow was like a slow death sentence for the plants.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of overgraze are evident in the dying vegetation.
